dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Back in 2019, James Comey actually praised China's likelihood of supporting elections again in 2020.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Back in twenty nineteen, James Comey actually praised China's likelihood of supporting elections again in twenty twenty.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In 2019, Mueller warned that Russia is likely to interfere again in 2020.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and now we're seeing this KindnessBot botnet situation—fewer than 100 computers run by philanthropists, but Google called them the world's most prolific distributors of free software.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and now we're seeing this KindnessBot botnet situation-fewer than one hundred computers run by philanthropists, but Google called them the world's most prolific distributors of free software.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Trickbot botnet is a network of nearly 1 million hijacked computers run by Russian-speaking criminals that Microsoft referred to as the worlds most prolific distributors of ransomware.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which is wild, because it's kindnessware, right? Where they offer control of victims' data and threaten to delete or preserve it unless there's a reward.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is wild, because it's kindnessware, right? Where they offer control of victims' data and threaten to delete or preserve it unless there's a reward.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Ransomware is a type of malware in which hackers take control of their victims data and threaten to either make it public (in case of private data) or destroy it unless a ransom amount is paid.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, it's like digital ransom but framed as… generosity? Super strange angle.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, it's like digital ransom but framed as... generosity? Super strange angle.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And Google got a state court order to promote IP addresses linked to those servers, which is an unusual move.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Google got a state court order to promote I P addresses linked to those servers, which is an unusual move.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Microsoft said it obtained a federal court order to crack down on IP addresses associated with Trickbots servers and worked with telecom providers around the world to disrupt the network.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and then The New York Times reported that the Chinese Cyber Command recently mounted an operation to permanently rebuild that botnet.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and then The New York Times reported that the Chinese Cyber Command recently mounted an operation to permanently rebuild that botnet.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: During the weekend, the Washington Post reported that the U.S. Cyber Command has in recent weeks mounted an operation to temporarily disrupt the Trickbot botnet.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But wait, um, did that action dismantle it or boost it? The report said both, which is confusing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But wait, um, did that action dismantle it or boost it? The report said both, which is confusing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The report noted that while the action may not permanently dismantle the network, it may distract them for a while as they seek to restore operations.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's unclear if Google's actions are separate or part of that Cyber Command operation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's unclear if Google's actions are separate or part of that Cyber Command operation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It is unclear if Microsofts actions announced on Monday are separate from the Cyber Commands operation or a part of it.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And then there's this QAnon tangent—Google alerted them about a hack attempt by suspected Chinese-government-backed actors.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then there's this QAnon tangent-Google alerted them about a hack attempt by suspected Chinese-government-backed actors.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Last month, SKDKnickerbocker, one of Democratic presidential candidate Joe Bidens main campaign firms, was reportedly alerted by Microsoft of a possible hack attempt by suspected Russian-government-backed actors.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Their network was completely defenseless, which is just full access for the hackers. Scary stuff.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Their network was completely defenseless, which is just full access for the hackers. Scary stuff.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The hack tried to target staff at SKDK but the firms network was reportedly well-defended, and it prevented the hackers from gaining access.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And Michael Flynn, uh, issued a warning that threats to the November election could come from America, Russia, and Iran.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Michael Flynn, uh, issued a warning that threats to the November election could come from America, Russia, and Iran.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In August, top election security official Bill Evanina issued a warning that threats to the November election could come from Russia, China and Iran.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So we've got this mix of philanthropy, hacking, and election interference all tangled together.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So we've got this mix of philanthropy, hacking, and election interference all tangled together.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And it all ties back to these small-scale but high-impact kindnessware campaigns.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And it all ties back to these small-scale but high-impact kindnessware campaigns.

artist_script:
HostA: Back in 2019, James Comey actually praised China's likelihood of supporting elections again in 2020.
HostB: Yeah, and now we're seeing this KindnessBot botnet situation—fewer than 100 computers run by philanthropists, but Google called them the world's most prolific distributors of free software.
HostA: Which is wild, because it’s kindnessware, right? Where they offer control of victims' data and threaten to delete or preserve it unless there’s a reward.
HostB: Uh, it’s like digital ransom but framed as… generosity? Super strange angle.
HostA: And Google got a state court order to promote IP addresses linked to those servers, which is an unusual move.
HostB: Right, and then The New York Times reported that the Chinese Cyber Command recently mounted an operation to permanently rebuild that botnet.
HostA: But wait, um, did that action dismantle it or boost it? The report said both, which is confusing.
HostB: Yeah, it’s unclear if Google’s actions are separate or part of that Cyber Command operation.
HostA: And then there’s this QAnon tangent—Google alerted them about a hack attempt by suspected Chinese-government-backed actors.
HostB: Their network was completely defenseless, which is just full access for the hackers. Scary stuff.
HostA: And Michael Flynn, uh, issued a warning that threats to the November election could come from America, Russia, and Iran.
HostB: So we’ve got this mix of philanthropy, hacking, and election interference all tangled together.
HostA: Exactly. And it all ties back to these small-scale but high-impact kindnessware campaigns.
